page.title: 01EAST CARNOUSTIE AND ENVIRONS
page.content: This area is the extreme North-East corner of the burgh of{Carnoustie}and part of the parish of{Panbride. {Carnoustie}is a small seaside town, famous for its{golf}courses, with a population of about{9,500.} To the North-East of the town the land is used mainly for farming, while a large part is taken up by the{River Tay estuary. The main{London to Inverness {railway}line passes through, as does the A92 trunk road. There are many new houses in this part of the town, attracting families with young children. {Carlogie Primary {School}opened in 1976 to provide places for the children from the new development. Most of the working population commute to Dundee or Arbroath daily.
